intro: Dyschoriste capitata, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in dense, umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Dyschoriste capitata typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
